Key Match Events: LA Clippers came away with a 110-96 win over the Mavericks during the preseason game.
P.J. Washington returned to the lineup and finished with 10 points, three rebounds, and three steals.
Klay Thompson struggled on the offensive end and went scoreless, missing all nine of his shot attempts, including six 3-pointers.
Quentin Grimes had his best game of the preseason with a team-high 20 points.
Veteran forward Derrick Jones Jr. played against his former team for the first time since joining the Clippers in free agency and helped his new team with 12 points and four rebounds.
Pre-Game Insights: James Harden signed a two-year, $70 million contract extension in the summer and will shoulder the burden of the offensive load for the Clippers.
Kawhi Leonard won’t play in the preseason as he continues to recover from offseason knee surgery.
The Clippers have added Kevin Porter Jr. and Kai Jones, two athletic wings that could provide an immediate impact on defense and in transition offense.
The Mavericks were without Luka Doncic (left calf contusion) and Kyrie Irving (rest) during the preseason game.
Post-Match Reflections: Mavericks coach Jason Kidd emphasized his own team as the main priority and reflected on Derrick Jones Jr.'s brief stint with the Mavericks.
Jason Kidd praised the Clippers' new arena, Intuit Dome, and expressed excitement about being the first visiting team to play there.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavericks were the final team to play against the Clippers while they still called Crypto.com Arena their home and the first opponent to play against LA in their new arena, Intuit Dome.
